svcsubproc.title: Driver Seat Belts
svcsubproc.para: The standard driver seat belt assembly is a three point lap and shoulder harness assembly, with retractor. The shoulder harness and the shoulder harness mounting assembly are attached to the structural pillar at the rear of the driver side sliding side window. The lap connection is mounted to the driver's floor riser assembly. The lap connector assembly is bolted through the floor utilizing grade eight structural bolts and lock nuts and washers.

warning.para: The seat belt should be considered to have a limited life and must be replaced as needed throughout the life of the vehicle. The belts must be inspected for needed care and maintenance every 20,000 miles or more often if exposed to severe environmental or vocational conditions. All belts should be replaced at least every 5 years. Failure to maintain the seat belts could weaken the system, resulting in personal injury or death.

step1.para: To replace the shoulder harness assembly, locate the shoulder harness mounting bolts on the driver side sliding window pillar. Remove the bolt cap covers.

step1.para: Loosen the three mounting bolts and remove the shoulder harness assembly from the pillar at the rear of the driver side sliding window.
Locate the lower left hand lap belt connector, and mounting bolts on the left hand side of the driver seat cushion base.

To remove the lap clip assembly, locate the mounting bolt on the driver seat riser assembly. With an assistant securing the lock nut and washer from under the riser assembly, loosen and remove the lap clip assembly mounting bolt. (On suspension seats the right hand latch assembly is mounted to the seat.)
Locate the floor mounted attaching point for the driver seat belt assembly.

step1.para: With the assistant below the floor, loosen and remove the seat belt floor attachment bolt.
Remove the seat belt attachment assembly.

When replacing the shoulder harness and lap belt assembly, replace both parts at the same time. Do not mix and match shoulder harness and lap assemblies as failure could occur if parts are mismatched.
